_header: Whilom as old stories tellen us
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Knight’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 2249 lines in couplets

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Whilom as olde stories tellen vsTher was a Duke that hight
                    Theseus…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…thus endith Palamon & EmelieAnd god saue al this companye
                    Amen
BodArcSelB14.Note: I.2720 omitted; 2603-4 reversed; 2953-4 inserted in margin.
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next / folwith the Knyghtis tale of Arcyte and Palamon (f.
                        15v); the knyght (RT); Here endith the knyght his tale of Arcite
                    and / Palamon… (f. 47)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Whilom was as old stories tellen vsTher was a duk þat hight
                    theseus…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…Thus endith palamon And EmelyAnd god saue alle this fair
                    Cumpanye
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…Here begynnyth þe prolog of þe knyȝtes tale (f.
                        4v); The knyght (RT); The knyȝt (RT); Here begynnyth the
                    knyȝtes tale (f. 5, following I.892)

Bod414.First Lines:
[W]hilom as olde stories tellen vsTher was a duke that hight
                    Theseus…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Thus endith Palamon and EmelyAnd god saue alle this feir
                    cumpany
Bod414.Attributed Title:
Iamque domos patria Scithice post aspera / gentis prelia laurigeno
                    (f. 10)

Bod686.First Lines:
Whilom was as olde stories tellen vsTher was a duk þat hight
                    Teseus…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…[smudge]lamon and emelyeAnd god save al þis feire
                    companye

BodHatDon1.First Lines:

BodHatDon1.Last Lines:

BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
Here beginneth the Knightes tale (f. 10); The knightes tale (RT); here
                    endeth þe knightez tale… (f. 36, margin)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:

BodLauMis739.First Lines:

                        & cetera (f. 13v)

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:

BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:

                    company

BodRawPoe223.First Lines:

CULDd424.First Lines:
Whilom there was as olde stories tellen vsA Duke a worthy man that
                    hight Theseus…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…Thus endeth Palamon and EmelyeAnd god saue al this fair
                    companye
CULDd424.Note:
I.920-1170, 1502-931, 2927-3016 lost; 2681-2, 2754-7, 2779-82 omitted.
                    ‘Amen quod  Wytton’ in the margin next
                    to 3108.
CULDd424.Attributed Title:
Iamque domos patrias scithice post aspera gentis prelia laurigero &
                        cetera / Here bygynneth the knyghtes tale (f. 13)

CULGg427.First Lines:
…And ryȝt anon with oute more abodHese baner he
                    displayeþ & forth rod…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…Thus endyth Palamoun & EmelyeAnd god saue al this fayre
                    cumpaynye
CULGg427.Note:

                    1917, 2411 inserted at foot. Bottom half of f. 175 torn away.

CULIi326.First Lines:
Whilom there was as an olde storye telleth vsA duke that hight
                    Thesius…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…Thus endeth Palamon and EmelyAnd god save all this faire
                    companyAmen
CULIi326.Note:
I.1148-61, 1193-200, 1220, 1462, 1843-4, 1943, 2250, 2655, 2958, 3058
                    omitted; 895-6, 2603-4, 2831+2-2829+30 reversed; spurious lines follow 1218,
                    1466, 2248, 2656; 1800 left blank and subsequently supplied; blank line follows
                    2457.
CULIi326.Attributed Title:
Knyght (RT); Here Endith the knyghtis tale… (f.
                    36v)

CULMm25.First Lines:
Whilom was as olde stories tellen usTher was a duke þat
                    hiȝhte Theseus…
CULMm25.Last Lines:
…Thus endeth palemon and EmelyeAnd god saue all þis faire
                    compaignye
CULMm25.Note:
I.1126-7, 2655, 2720 omitted; 1452, 2654, 2934 inserted in margin;
                    spurious line follows 2656. Iam que domos patrias scithice post aspera gentis

                    written as if lines of text.
CULMm25.Attributed Title:
…Here begynneth þe knyghtis taale (f. 10); ffabula
                        militis (RT); Here endeth þe knyghtes tale… (f. 34)

BLHar1758.First Lines:
…Vyctorie & as a conquerour to lyuenNot greueth vs youre

                    companye

BLHar7333.First Lines:
Wylom was as olde storyes tellyn vsþer was a duke þat
                    heyght theseus…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…þus Eondithe Palamoun & EmelyeAnd god save nowe al
                    this companye
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
Nowe here firste begynnyþe þe prologe of þe / kneytis tale
                    (f. 33va; introduces the General Prologue); Loo here
                    eondiþe þe prologe of þe Knightes / tale and ffolowyng þe
                    knyght be gynnithe to telle his tale (f. 41vb); Þe Knightes Tale
                    (RT); Loo þus here eondiþe the kyntes tale… (f.
                        53va)
